comment: * Information about the current build, extracted from system properties.

variables.name: UNKNOWN
variables.comment: Value used for when a build property is unknown.

variables.name: ID
variables.comment: Either a changelist number, or a label like "M4-rc20".

variables.name: DISPLAY
variables.comment: A build ID string meant for displaying to the user

variables.name: PRODUCT
variables.comment: The name of the overall product.

variables.name: DEVICE
variables.comment: The name of the industrial design.

variables.name: BOARD
variables.comment: The name of the underlying board, like "goldfish".

variables.name: CPU_ABI
variables.comment:
* The name of the instruction set (CPU type + ABI convention) of native code.
     *
     * @deprecated Use {@link #SUPPORTED_ABIS} instead.

variables.name: CPU_ABI2
variables.comment:
* The name of the second instruction set (CPU type + ABI convention) of native code.
     *
     * @deprecated Use {@link #SUPPORTED_ABIS} instead.

variables.name: MANUFACTURER
variables.comment: The manufacturer of the product/hardware.

variables.name: BRAND
variables.comment: The consumer-visible brand with which the product/hardware will be associated, if any.

variables.name: MODEL
variables.comment: The end-user-visible name for the end product.

variables.name: BOOTLOADER
variables.comment: The system bootloader version number.

variables.name: RADIO
variables.comment:
* The radio firmware version number.
     *
     * @deprecated The radio firmware version is frequently not
     * available when this class is initialized, leading to a blank or
     * "unknown" value for this string.  Use
     * {@link #getRadioVersion} instead.

variables.name: HARDWARE
variables.comment: The name of the hardware (from the kernel command line or /proc).

variables.name: IS_EMULATOR
variables.comment:
* Whether this build was for an emulator device.
     * @hide

variables.name: SERIAL
variables.comment:
* A hardware serial number, if available. Alphanumeric only, case-insensitive.
     * This field is always set to {@link Build#UNKNOWN}.
     *
     * @deprecated Use {@link #getSerial()} instead.
     *

variables.name: SUPPORTED_ABIS
variables.comment:
* An ordered list of ABIs supported by this device. The most preferred ABI is the first
     * element in the list.
     *
     * See {@link #SUPPORTED_32_BIT_ABIS} and {@link #SUPPORTED_64_BIT_ABIS}.

variables.name: SUPPORTED_32_BIT_ABIS
variables.comment: * An ordered list of 32 bit ABIs supported by this device. The most preferred ABI * is the first element in the list. * * See {@link #SUPPORTED_ABIS} and {@link #SUPPORTED_64_BIT_ABIS}.

variables.name: SUPPORTED_64_BIT_ABIS
variables.comment: * An ordered list of 64 bit ABIs supported by this device. The most preferred ABI * is the first element in the list. * * See {@link #SUPPORTED_ABIS} and {@link #SUPPORTED_32_BIT_ABIS}.

variables.name: TYPE
variables.comment: The type of build, like "user" or "eng".

variables.name: TAGS
variables.comment: Comma-separated tags describing the build, like "unsigned,debug".

variables.name: FINGERPRINT
variables.comment: A string that uniquely identifies this build.  Do not attempt to parse this value.

variables.name: IS_TREBLE_ENABLED
variables.comment:
* True if Treble is enabled and required for this device.
     *
     * @hide

variables.name: TIME
variables.comment: The time at which the build was produced, given in milliseconds since the UNIX epoch.

variables.name: IS_DEBUGGABLE
variables.comment:
* Returns true if we are running a debug build such as "user-debug" or "eng".
     * @hide

variables.name: IS_ENG
variables.comment: {@hide}

variables.name: IS_USERDEBUG
variables.comment: {@hide}

variables.name: IS_USER
variables.comment: {@hide}

variables.name: IS_CONTAINER
variables.comment:
* Whether this build is running inside a container.
     *
     * We should try to avoid checking this flag if possible to minimize
     * unnecessarily diverging from non-container Android behavior.
     * Checking this flag is acceptable when low-level resources being
     * different, e.g. the availability of certain capabilities, access to
     * system resources being restricted, and the fact that the host OS might
     * handle some features for us.
     * For higher-level behavior differences, other checks should be preferred.
     * @hide

variables.name: PERMISSIONS_REVIEW_REQUIRED
variables.comment:
* Specifies whether the permissions needed by a legacy app should be
     * reviewed before any of its components can run. A legacy app is one
     * with targetSdkVersion < 23, i.e apps using the old permission model.
     * If review is not required, permissions are reviewed before the app
     * is installed.
     *
     * @hide
     * @removed

methods.name: public static String getSerial()
methods.comment:
* Gets the hardware serial number, if available. * *

Note: Root access may allow you to modify device identifiers, such as * the hardware serial number. If you change these identifiers, you can use * key attestation to obtain * proof of the device's original identifiers. * *

Starting with API level 29, persistent device identifiers are guarded behind additional * restrictions, and apps are recommended to use resettable identifiers (see Best practices for unique identifiers). This method can be invoked if one of * the following requirements is met: *

    *
  • If the calling app has been granted the READ_PRIVILEGED_PHONE_STATE permission; this * is a privileged permission that can only be granted to apps preloaded on the device. *
  • If the calling app is the device or profile owner and has been granted the * {@link Manifest.permission#READ_PHONE_STATE} permission. The profile owner is an app that * owns a managed profile on the device; for more details see Work profiles. * Profile owner access is deprecated and will be removed in a future release. *
  • If the calling app has carrier privileges (see {@link * android.telephony.TelephonyManager#hasCarrierPrivileges}) on any active subscription. *
  • If the calling app is the default SMS role holder (see {@link * android.app.role.RoleManager#isRoleHeld(String)}). *
* *

If the calling app does not meet one of these requirements then this method will behave * as follows: * *

    *
  • If the calling app's target SDK is API level 28 or lower and the app has the * READ_PHONE_STATE permission then {@link Build#UNKNOWN} is returned.
    • *
  • If the calling app's target SDK is API level 28 or lower and the app does not have * the READ_PHONE_STATE permission, or if the calling app is targeting API level 29 or * higher, then a SecurityException is thrown.
    • *
* * @return The serial number if specified.

methods.name: private static String deriveFingerprint()
methods.comment:
* Some devices split the fingerprint components between multiple
     * partitions, so we might derive the fingerprint at runtime.

methods.name: public static void ensureFingerprintProperty()
methods.comment:
* Ensure that raw fingerprint system property is defined. If it was derived
     * dynamically by {@link #deriveFingerprint()} this is where we push the
     * derived value into the property service.
     *
     * @hide

methods.name: public static boolean isBuildConsistent()
methods.comment:
* Verifies the current flash of the device is consistent with what
     * was expected at build time.
     *
     * Treble devices will verify the Vendor Interface (VINTF). A device
     * launched without Treble:
     *
     * 1) Checks that device fingerprint is defined and that it matches across
     *    various partitions.
     * 2) Verifies radio and bootloader partitions are those expected in the build.
     *
     * @hide

methods.name: public static List<Partition> getFingerprintedPartitions()
methods.comment:
* Get build information about partitions that have a separate fingerprint defined.
     *
     * The list includes partitions that are suitable candidates for over-the-air updates. This is
     * not an exhaustive list of partitions on the device.

methods.name: public static String getRadioVersion()
methods.comment:
* Returns the version string for the radio firmware.  May return
     * null (if, for instance, the radio is not currently on).

methods.name: private static String[] getStringList(String property, String separator)
private static String joinListOrElse(List<T> list, String defaultValue)

methodNames: private static String[] getStringList(String property, String separator)
private static String joinListOrElse(List<T> list, String defaultValue)
